chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: nat
x: nat
p2: nat
p1: nat
q: nat

Goal:
q <> 0 -> ~ divides q p1 -> ~ divides q p2 -> Nat.pow q x * p1 = Nat.pow q y * p2 -> x = y

Premises:
BinNat.N.pow = fun n p : BinNums.N => match p with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Npos p0 => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.pow q p0) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNat.N.pow (_ _)%N_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Module Nat := Struct Definition t : Set. Definition zero : nat. Definition one : nat. Definition two : nat. Definition succ : nat -> nat. Definition pred : nat -> nat. Definition add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition double : nat -> nat. Definition mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition sub : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition eqb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition leb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition ltb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition compare : nat -> nat -> comparison. Definition max : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition min : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition even : nat -> bool. Definition odd : nat -> bool. Definition pow : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_addmul : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition of_uint_acc : Decimal.uint -> nat -> nat. Definition of_uint : Decimal.uint -> nat.
power_factor_uniq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> ~ divides p x -> ~ divides p y -> p ^ i * x = p ^ j * y -> i = j /\ x = y
power_factor_lt_neq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> i < j -> ~ divides p x -> p ^ i * x <> p ^ j * y
not_prime_1 = fun H : prime 1 => match H with | conj H0 x => match H0 eq_refl return ((forall q : nat, divides q 1 -> q = 1 \/ q = 1) -> False) with end x end : ~ prime 1
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, divides x y -> divides y z -> divides x z
gcd.divides_mult_inv : forall k p q : nat, k <> 0 -> divides (k * p) (k * q) -> divides p q
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> divides p q -> p <= q
divides_div : forall q p : nat, divides p q -> q = div q p * p
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = a / b
prime_divides : forall p q : nat, prime p -> prime q -> divides p q -> p = q
divides_mult_inv : forall p x y : nat, prime p -> divides p (x * y) -> divides p x \/ divides p y
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_rel_prime_div : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> divides p (q * k) -> divides p k
is_rel_prime_div_r : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> divides p (k * q) -> divides p k
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
divides_mult_r : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (q * k)
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)
divides_mult_inv_l : forall p q r : nat, divides (p * q) r -> divides p r /\ divides q r
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
pow2_dec_uniq : forall p a q b : nat, pow2 p * (2 * a + 1) = pow2 q * (2 * b + 1) -> p = q /\ a = b
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ divides p q

```coq
intros Hq Hp1 Hp2 Heq.
apply power_factor_uniq with (p:=q) (i:=x) (j:=y); auto.
Qed.```

original: intros Hq Hp1 Hp2 Heq. apply power_factor_uniq with (p:=q) (i:=x) (j:=y); auto.
